class.name: SpatializerParameters
class.description: Implementations of [AudioSpatializer] can extend this class to hold any sort of physics calculations necessary for calculating audio spatialization. Calls to [method AudioSpatializerInstance.calculate_spatialization] should instantiate and populate it, before returning it each frame. Implementations should extend [SpatializerParameters], but should set the parameters of this class to configure how the [AudioSpatializer] mixes the sound. Note: [method AudioSpatializerInstance.calculate_spatialization] is called during the physics process, and thus has access to the physics subsystem.

method.name: add_bus_volume
method.description: Add a list of linear audio volumes for the specified audio bus. [param bus] should correspond to a valid audio bus. [param volumes] should be an array of size 4, where each index corresponds to a different pair of volumes for the different stereo channels. Volumes are added to a dictionary, keyed by [param bus].

method.name: get_bus_volumes
method.description: Return the internal bus volumes dictionary, constructed with calls to [method add_bus_volume].

members.member: A [PackedVector2Array] of size 4, where each entry corresponds to an internal stereo audio channel ([code]0[/code] is front left/right, [code]1[/code] is center/LFE, [code]2[/code] is rear left/right, [code]3[/code] is side left/right).

The pitch scale used to sample the [AudioStreamPlayback] each time mix is called. Should be set to the [member AudioStreamPlayerSpatial.pitch_scale]; use [method AudioSpatializerInstance.get_audio_player] to access the audio player.

A flag used by [AudioSpatializer] to determine whether or not to send the audio bus_volumes to the [AudioServer] this frame. May be used to not send the values if, for example, the sound is out of range of any listeners, and should not be updating volumes that haven't changed.
